lines.text:
[on her new nickname]
Wee Willie Winkie. It does sound like a soldier, doesn't it?
Aye.
Then I'd be Private Winkie!
Private Winkie it is. A full-fledged soldier of the Queen!

[about the Colonel]
I think he's gonna like you, Mommy. Even if he doesn't like me.
You made a very good beginning.
Yes, but who ever head of a solider named Priscilla?
Aye, that's the point. You couldn't take Private Pricilla very seriously, could you? We'll have to find a new name for you.
[pauses]
I got it! I got it! Wee Willie Winkie.
Wee Willie Winkie?
[They both laugh]
Was he a friend of yours?

Nah, he was a lad in an old scotch rhyme. Wee Willie Winkie ran through the town... Wee Willie Winkie ran through the town... he ran through the... well,he was a lad who was always getting himself into difficulties.
Coppy, I'm kinda worried.
You are? About what?
I've gotta be a solider and I don't know where to start.
Who put that idea into your head?
The Colonel. You see, the colonel never had any little girls around. All he understands in soliders. So I've decided to be one. Then he'll like me. How do I start, Coppy?
But he was so glad to get back his necklace, Sergeant.
Well, it will take more than a necklace to get him out of that jail.
But why are they gonna put him in jail?
Because he's a blackhearted thieving batan, that's why.
But he was such a nice gentleman.
Gentleman? Pah! A gentleman, why he'd cut your head off as soon as he'd get ya.
